description.narrative: For GGF funds will be used to organize a workshop that would bring together traditional chiefs and elders from Gaena'alu Movement and the Moli House of Chiefs to share their knowledge and experience with young people on traditional environmental stewardship of marine and terrestrial resources. Experts from the Ministry of Environment and the Ministry of Agriculture will come to the workshop to give presentations on food security and effects of climate change on Solomon Islands. Following the workshop, young people will designate certain areas as protected through traditional practice. Students will write a management plan for the protected natural area incorporating traditional and modern sustainable resource management approaches. 129 young people will take part in the project
